text: Man mot hine gebiddan, swaswa he mæg & can, mid ælcum gereorde & on ælcere stowe.
Nu is her on englisc andetnyss & gebed.
Ac seðe þis singan wylle, ne secge he na mare on þære andetnysse þonne he wyrcende wæs, forþonðe ure hælend nele, þæt man on hine sylfne leoge, ne eac ealle menn on ane wisan ne syngiað.

Ic eom andetta ælmihtigan gode & eac minum scrifte ealle þa synna, þe me æfre awyrgede gastas on besmiten habbað, oþþe on þigene & on æthryne, on geogoðe <&> on ylde, witende & nitende, willende & nellende, on gesundfulnysse & on þan halnesse, þe ic ongean godes willen gefremede.
Geswicnesse ic behate, & æfter þinre tæcinga dædbetan wyllæ, gif me lifes fruma fyrstes geunnan wille.
Ic bidde þe eadmodlice, þe min gastlica lareow eart, þæt ðu me foreþingie & æt mines drihtnes þrymsetle on domesdæge minre andetnyssa gewita si.
